cloud.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water
cloud.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Dark clouds floated across the moon.
Heavy clouds had gathered over the summit of Mont Blanc.
Visibility was bad due to low cloud.
cloud.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a mass of dust, smoke etc in the air, or a large number of insects flying together
cloud.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: clouds of mosquitoes buzzing around us
A cloud of steam rose into the air.
cloud.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: something that makes you feel afraid, worried, unhappy etc
cloud.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Fears of renewed terrorist attacks cast a cloud over the event  (=spoilt the happy situation).
He returned to New York under a cloud of gloom and despair.
The only cloud on the horizon was her mother’s illness.
cloud.translation[0].note_box[0].section: A dark cloud covered the sun.
There was a bright blue sky with a few white clouds.
By midday, heavy clouds had spread across the sky.
The weather was overcast, with heavy low clouds.
Dark storm clouds were moving in from the Atlantic.
The sky had been full of rain clouds for days.
A heavy bank of cloud was creeping across the sky.
The moon was shining through a thin layer of cloud.
The plane flew through occasional wisps of cloud.
Long narrow bands of cloud stretched across the valley.
In the morning, a blanket of cloud still covered the country.
A thin veil of cloud hid the moon.
The sky had darkened and clouds had gathered.
For days thick cloud had covered the whole sky.
At last the rain had stopped and the clouds had cleared.
Suddenly the clouds that covered the moon parted.
A narrow band of cloud has been moving across the country.
A few clouds drifted across the top of the mountains.
A wind was blowing and soft clouds were scudding across the sky.
Heavy grey clouds hung low in the sky.
The cloud cover should disappear by the afternoon.
There are many different types of cloud formation.
cloud.translation[0].note_box[1].section: cloud
a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water
The storm was still a way off but black clouds were gathering.
Thick cloud obscured the top of the hill.
fog
very thick cloud near the ground which is difficult to see through
The cars crashed into each other in thick fog.
The fog had lifted  (=disappeared)slightly.
mist
light cloud near the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far. Mist is usually not as thick as fog. You often get mist near areas of water or mountains
The morning mist was lifting and the sun was coming up.
A grey mist hung over the water.
The hills were shrouded in mist  (=surrounded by mist).
haze
smoke, dust, or mist in the air which is difficult to see through
He saw the horses coming towards him through a haze of dust.
The road shimmered in the heat haze.
A pale blue haze hung over the far-off mountains.
smog
dirty air that looks like a mixture of smoke and fog, caused by smoke from cars and factories in cities
The city is covered in smog for much of the year.
A smog warning was issued for parts of Southern Oregon.
thundercloud
a large dark cloud that you see before or during a storm
He watched the thunderclouds roll across the valley.
vapour trail
the white line that is left in the sky by a plane
High overhead, a jet left its vapour trail across the blue sky.
cloud.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to make someone less able to think clearly or make sensible decisions
cloud.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Don’t let your personal feelings cloud your judgement.
cloud.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if someone’s face or eyes cloud, or if something clouds them, they start to look angry, sad, or worried
cloud.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Ann’s eyes clouded with the pain.
cloud.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to make something less pleasant or more difficult than it should have been
cloud.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Her happiness was clouded by having to leave her son behind.
cloud.translation[1].definitions[2].note: Cloud is usually passive in this meaning
cloud.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: if glass or a liquid clouds, or if something clouds it, it becomes less clear and more difficult to see through
cloud.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: The water clouded and I could no longer see the river bed.
cloud.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: Thick mist clouded the mountain tops.
cloud.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: using or related to cloud computing
